statements.statement: 1.My students are unmotivated to participate in class activities.
1.学生对课堂活动缺乏积极性。
2.The content in the instructional materials is not relevant to the course objectives.
2.教材内容与课程目标脱节。
3.My students refuse to speak English in class.
3.学生拒绝在课堂上使用汉语。
4.Speaking English in class makes me anxious.
4.在课堂上说汉语让我感到焦虑。
5.I become sarcastic with my students.
5.我会对学生表现出讽刺态度。
6.I often show my negative emotions to my students.
6.我常向学生表露负面情绪。
7.I try to avoid talking with troublesome students.
7.我尽量避免与“问题学生”交流。
8.My students show little interest in English.
8.学生对汉语学习兴趣不高。
9.My students don’t respond to my questions.
9.学生不回应我的提问。
10.I sometimes use my own teaching materials as a supplement.
10.我有时会使用自编教材作为补充材料。
11.I harshly criticize my students for their lack of participation.
11.我因为学生（课堂）参与度低而严厉批评他们。
12.I don’t know if my teaching approach is effective.
我不确定自己的教学方法是否有效。
13.When I experience anxiety in class, I try to hide it.
13.当我在课堂上感到焦虑时，我会尽量掩饰情绪。
14.I try to ignore students or things that make me feel uncomfortable in class.
14.在课堂上，我会尽量忽视让我不适的学生或情况。
15.My students don’t interact with their classmates.
15.学生之间缺乏互动。
16.When my students become demotivated, I ask them questions or ask them to share their thoughts.
16.当学生学习动力下降时，我会提问或倾听他们的真实想法。
17.My students doubt my teaching ability.
17.学生质疑我的教学能力。
18.I share my classroom problems with my colleagues or superior.
18.我会和同事或上级讨论课堂问题。
19.My students say negative things about me behind my back.
19.学生私下对我进行负面评价。
20.When my students make me angry in class, I try to advise them.
20.学生让我生气时，我会尝试劝导他们。
21.I threaten my students with punishment.
21.我会用惩罚警告学生。
22.I’m working on improving my English so that I can communicate more effectively in class.
22.我正努力提升汉语能力，以便在课堂上更高效地沟通。
23.My students don’t complete their assignments.
23.学生未按时完成作业。
24.I try to avoid discussing certain topics that may bring about negative emotions.
24.我会尽量避免讨论可能引发负面情绪的话题。
25.I give my students choices (e.g., reading topics, assignment formats).
25.我为学生提供选择（例如，阅读话题或作业形式）。
26.I doubt my own English skills.
26.我对自己的汉语能力存有疑虑。
27.When I receive no response from my students, I adjust the question or ask an easier question.
27.当学生没有回应时，我会调整问题或降低难度。
28.I share my classroom problems with my family members or friends.
28.我会向家人或朋友倾诉课堂问题。
29.My students’ work is of low quality.
29.学生的作业质量较低。
30.When I feel hopeless in class, I seek advice from experts.
30.在课堂上感到无助时，我会向专家寻求建议。
31.My students interrupt me, joke, or chat with each other while I am talking.
31.我讲话时，学生常常打断我、开玩笑或互相闲聊。
32.My students don’t ask questions in class.
32.学生在课堂上不主动提问。
33.When my students fail to complete their assignments, I adjust the assignments.
33.当学生未能完成作业时，我会调整作业。
34.My students ask too many questions.
34.学生提问过多。
35.When I feel helpless in class, I think critically about my teaching approach.
35.当我在课堂上感到无助时，我会反思我的教学方法是否得当。
36.I try to reduce the tension I feel in class by reminding myself that there are more important things in my life.
36.当我在课堂上感到紧张时，我会提醒自己生活中还有更重要的事情，以缓解压力。
37.My students haven’t made any progress in English.
37.学生的汉语未见提升。
38.When I feel frustrated in class, I shift my attention to something pleasant.
38.当我在课堂上感到沮丧时，我会将注意力转移到积极的事物上。
39.The instructional materials do not match my students’ English proficiency.
39.教学材料与学生的汉语水平不匹配。
40.When my students’ misbehavior makes me angry, I remind myself that they are inexperienced.
40.当学生的不当行为让我生气时，我会提醒自己他们缺乏阅历。
